message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AR, cs.SE, cs.ET, cs.SY

The paper discusses the security vulnerability of Approximate Computing (AC) synthesis, which involves the design of hardware systems that sacrifice computational accuracy for energy efficiency. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR), as the paper analyzes the threat landscape and provides a defense framework for trustworthy AC synthesis. Additionally, the paper involves the design and synthesis of hardware systems, which falls under the categories of computer architecture (cs.AR) and embedded systems (cs.ET). The paper also discusses the challenges in ensuring the quality of results in AC, which falls under the category of software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper discusses the broader view of attack and defense strategies, which falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY).
